snippet: The Guggenheim’s “Zero: Countdown to Tomorrow, 1950s-60s” is an alternately dazzling and thin walk-in history lesson about the three Zero artists of postwar Germany.
abstract: Roberta Smith reviews exhibition honoring Heinz Mack, Otto Piene and Gunther Uecker, three Zero artists of postwar Germany, at the Guggenheim.
lead_paragraph: The Guggenheim’s “Zero: Countdown to Tomorrow, 1950s-60s” is an alternately dazzling and thin walk-in history lesson about the three Zero artists of postwar Germany.

headline.seo: ‘Zero,’ a Look at a Movement, at the Guggenheim
headline.main: 3 Men and a Posse, Chasing Newness
headline.print_headline: 3 Men and a Posse, Chasing Newness
